thought.author: Chinese Proverb
description: ðŸŽ¯ Regardless of your specific industry, area of expertise or [INSERT WHATEVER YOU WANT HERE], if you want to be successful and grow in the future, the best time to act is now.

Today's #ThoughtsOnProgramming features a Chinese proverb which we've shamelessly stolen from Will Sack's presentation "How to fundraise successfully during a pandemic". Will is the founder of Kindara, a digital health platform and community for women. He also provides training for entrepreneurs on fundraising through his accelerator program at GetFunded.
thought.quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.

thought.author: Ralph Johnson
description: Today's issue of #ThoughtsOnProgramming features Ralph Johnson, co-author of the "Design Pattern bible" with a friendly reminder on the importance of creating software which is useful to specific users for achieving a defined goal effectively and with efficiency.
thought.quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.

thought.author: Cory House
description: Code for humans, not machines! We just can't overemphasis enough the importance of writing clean, comprehensive and maintainable code. Today's #ThoughtsOnProgramming features Cory House with a superb analogy on why your code should tell a story and be self-explanatory.
thought.quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, itâ€™s bad.
